title: Alawites in Syrian town of Baniyas recount horror: 'The survivors are the ones Sunni families hid'
summary: In the Al-Qusour district, residents are trying to go back to their lives after the deadly attacks carried out by various factions between March 6 and 9. They describe days of hell during which many of their loved ones and neighbors were executed.

title: Putin tells Ukraine troops in Russian region to 'surrender'
summary: Russia has mounted a rapid counteroffensive in the western border region of Kursk over the past week, recapturing much of the territory Ukraine seized in a shock incursion last August.

title: US Congress clears key hurdle in bid to avert govt shutdown
summary: The Republican-led Senate muscled the legislation through a preliminary ballot that required Democratic cooperation to reach a 60-vote threshold – clearing it for final passage before the midnight deadline. Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer had shocked Democrats when announcing on Thursday evening he would back the Republican-drafted six-month funding proposal.

title: Artificial intelligence: Google, OpenAI, Meta and Amazon turn to robotics
summary: AI companies are developing software and hardware for robots, whether for industrial or domestic use.

title: Trump administration backs TotalEnergies' controversial gas megaproject in Mozambique
summary: The US Export Credit Agency has approved a loan of nearly $5 billion for Mozambique LNG, something which had been refused under the Biden administration.

title: In Argentina, lowering the legal age for obtaining firearms is raising social concerns
summary: Any Argentinean from the age of 18 can initiate the process of obtaining a firearm, as opposed to 21 previously. This change reflects the government's pro-gun ideological line, which runs counter to society at large.

title: Crew launches for ISS, paving way for 'stranded' astronauts to return
summary: A new flight crew blasted off on a Falcon 9 rocket from the Kennedy Space Center in Florida on Friday evening, carrying a four-member team to swap out the two astronauts who have been on the International Space Station since June 2024.

title: Gold tops $3,000 for first time on Trump tariff war, stocks rebound
summary: Wall Street has been hammered in recent sessions by trade tensions, with the S&P 500 slipping into a technical correction Thursday, having fallen more than 10% from a record high it hit just last month. Some analysts warned that Friday's rebound would be short-lived.

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs pleads not guilty to new indictment
summary: Public allegations have been building against the former rap superstar since late 2023, when singer Cassie alleged Combs subjected her to more than a decade of coercion by physical force and drugs as well as a 2018 rape. Along with the federal criminal case, Combs faces a mountain of civil suits

title: Champagnes and European spirits risk becoming collateral damage in Trump's trade war
summary: The American president has threatened to impose 200% tariffs on these products in retaliation for defensive measures taken by the European Union. The French wine and spirits industry has sounded the alarm.

title: Hamas prepared to free Israeli-US hostage and remains of four dual nationals
summary: During indirect ceasefire talks in Doha, the Palestinian militants on Friday said they were 'ready to release the Israeli soldier Edan Alexander, who holds American citizenship, along with the remains of four others holding dual citizenship.'

title: Mark Carney sworn in as Canada's new prime minister
summary: The formal central banker, 59, replaces Justin Trudeau at a time when Canada is facing tariffs and annexation threats from US President Donald Trump.

title: When Louboutin and Galliano fit perfectly together
summary: The shoemaker and the former artistic director of Maison Margiela co-designed a collection revisiting cult patterns from their respective houses. These include the Kate pumps and the Tabi ballerina flats.

title: People evacuated and museums close in Tuscany amid flooding
summary: Torrential rains have caused Italian authorities to issue red alerts for parts of Tuscany and Emilia-Romagna. Dozens of people have been evacuated.

title: Trump administration efforts to deport pro-Palestinian student spark further protests
summary: Mahmoud Khalil, a Syrian who legally resides in the US, was arrested for allegedly distributing leaflets praising Hamas and the October 7 terrorist attack.

title: Teen sentenced to 12 years for killing parents and setting fire to house
summary: The psychiatrists who examined 17-year-old Valentin unanimously deemed that his discernment was impaired at the time of the events, as he suffers from an autistic disorder, associated with depression and psychotic symptoms.

title: Trump hails 'good and productive' talks with Putin on Ukraine
summary: 'There is a very good chance that this horrible, bloody war can finally come to an end,' US President Donald Trump said, without further details.

title: Invite from Israeli government opens new chapter for French far-right party with anti-Semitic past
summary: Israel long considered Marine Le Pen's Rassemblement National untouchable. But party chairman Jordan Bardella has been invited to speak at a conference in Jerusalem that will be concluded by Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: Gucci: A stylistic choice that disappoints the stock market
summary: The choice of Demna, creative director of Balenciaga, to take up the same position at Gucci, Kering's flagship brand, sent the luxury group's shares tumbling, losing more than 12% in early afternoon trading.

title: Laurence des Cars, saving the Louvre whatever the cost
summary: In order to fund the museum's colossal €800 million renovation plan, director Laurence des Cars has no shortage of ideas: prestigious galas, American donors and higher ticket prices for foreign visitors. But her direct approach is ruffling feathers in the museum world.

title: 'I saw us as the cliché of the 'sugar daddy' taking me to the restaurant': Mathilde and Christophe's 28-year age gap
summary: 'Family portraits.' The parents of Inès, 10, and Octave, 8, initially quiet about their relationship, managed to find a family balance despite their very different views on parenthood.

title: US expels South African ambassador, saying he 'hates' Trump
summary: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio described Ambassador Ebrahim Rasool, a former anti-apartheid campaigner, as 'a race-baiting politician who hates America and hates' Trump.

title: France 'determined' to cut debt as Fitch maintains rating
summary: Fitch maintained its AA- credit score on France's sovereign debt, but kept a negative outlook.

title: Trump determined to bring US justice system to heel
summary: The American president is stepping up the pressure on what he called 'corrupt' and 'evil' federal judges who oppose the executive orders he has signed since taking office. It's a tug-of-war between the executive and judicial branches that Trump is determined to win.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'Rather than austerity, Europe needs investment'
summary: To hear those in power tell it, you'd have to cut social spending to race with Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin on military spending. This diagnosis is all wrong, explains Thomas Piketty in his column.

title: France wary of Scotland spoiling Six Nations party
summary: The French men's rugby team hosts Scotland at the Stade de France on Saturday to conclude the tournament. While a bonus-point win would guarantee them the title, Les Bleus remain vigilant.

title: Putin will have to 'come to table,' British PM Starmer says, hosting coalition call
summary: Keir Starmer hosted a call with some 25 leaders of allied nations in the 'coalition of the willing' seeking to help enforce a potential truce between Russia and Ukraine.

title: Rodrigo Duterte, former Philippines president, appears before ICC's judges
summary: Following his extradition by Manila, the former leader appeared before the International Criminal Court on Friday, charged with possible crimes against humanity committed as part of his war on drugs.

title: French prosecutors launch manslaughter probe against TotalEnergies over Mozambique attack
summary: The investigation is into involuntary manslaughter and failure to assist persons in danger during the 2021 attack by Islamic State-linked militants in Palma, Mozambique.

title: NGOs contest Beauvais airport expansion, citing France's climate commitments
summary: Three NGOs are taking legal action against the new airport infrastructure concession contract, arguing that it is contrary to the 2015 Paris Agreement.
